00023 #ifndef __MLPACK_METHODS_KERNEL_PCA_NYSTROEM_METHOD_HPP
00024 #define __MLPACK_METHODS_KERNEL_PCA_NYSTROEM_METHOD_HPP
00025 
00026 #include <mlpack/core.hpp>
00027 #include <mlpack/methods/nystroem_method/kmeans_selection.hpp>
00028 #include <mlpack/methods/nystroem_method/nystroem_method.hpp>
00029 
00030 namespace mlpack {
00031 namespace kpca {
00032 
00033 template<
00034   typename KernelType,
00035   typename PointSelectionPolicy = kernel::KMeansSelection<> 
00036 >
00037 class NystroemKernelRule
00038 {
00039   public:
00050     static void ApplyKernelMatrix(const arma::mat& data,
00051                                   arma::mat& transformedData,
00052                                   arma::vec& eigval,
00053                                   arma::mat& eigvec,
00054                                   const size_t rank,
00055                                   KernelType kernel = KernelType())
00056     {
00057       arma::mat G, v;
00058       kernel::NystroemMethod<KernelType, PointSelectionPolicy> nm(data, kernel,
00059                                                         rank);
00060       nm.Apply(G);
00061       transformedData = G.t() * G;
00062 
00063       // For PCA the data has to be centered, even if the data is centered. But
00064       // it is not guaranteed that the data, when mapped to the kernel space, is
00065       // also centered. Since we actually never work in the feature space we 
00066       // cannot center the data. So, we perform a "psuedo-centering" using the
00067       // kernel matrix.
00068       arma::rowvec rowMean = arma::sum(transformedData, 0) / 
00069           transformedData.n_cols;
00070       transformedData.each_col() -= arma::sum(transformedData, 1) /
00071           transformedData.n_cols;
00072       transformedData.each_row() -= rowMean;
00073       transformedData += arma::sum(rowMean) / transformedData.n_cols;
00074 
00075       // Eigendecompose the centered kernel matrix.
00076       arma::svd(eigvec, eigval, v, transformedData);
00077       eigval %= eigval / (data.n_cols - 1);
00078 
00079       transformedData = eigvec.t() * G.t();
00080     }
00081 };
00082 
00083 }; // namespace kpca
00084 }; // namespace mlpack
00085 
00086 #endif
